body:
I think the implementation is correct. `_from_factorized` does not get the integer *codes*, but the actual uniques as plain numpy array. 
See the base implementation: 

https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/0c65c57a279e755ab7093db925d1e580f9878dae/pandas/core/arrays/base.py#L454-L460

The reason that we need `_from_factorized` is to convert the numpy array of uniques to an ExtensionArray, and because you might return different values in `_values_for_factorize` that have to be re-converted to actual extension array elements with custom code. 
But in the case of the DecimalArray it uses the default for `_values_for_factorize` which is the object array, and this then converts also back into a DecimalArray without anything special.

That said, the documentation (docstring of `from_factorized`) can certainly be improved to make this clearer.

See eg here for a more custom `_from_factorize`: https://github.com/geopandas/geopandas/pull/701/files#diff-f6d9d27a6d64f2c7bb9f16c4caf50eb5R502 (where I convert my geometries to binary blobs to factorize them, and thus in `_from_factorized` need to convert the binaries back to actual geometry objects)

Thanks for the explanation, that makes a lot more sense. You're right that I hadn't properly understood what these functions are supposed to do from the docstrings. Then I grepped for usage examples, ended up at `categorical.py` and misunderstood what that did.

An example just like

> where I convert my geometries to binary blobs to factorize them, and thus in _from_factorized need to convert the binaries back to actual geometry objects

would be great to have for clarification.

---

**EDIT:** Part of the confusion might have come from (`pandas/pandas/core/arrays/base.py`)
``` python
    @classmethod
    def _from_factorized(cls, values, original):
        """Reconstruct an ExtensionArray after factorization.

        Parameters
        ----------
        values : ndarray
            An integer ndarray with the factorized values.
        original : ExtensionArray
            The original ExtensionArray that factorize was called on.

        See Also
        --------
        pandas.factorize
        ExtensionArray.factorize
        """
        raise AbstractMethodError(cls)
```
which to me suggested that `values` would hold (integer) indexes.
